name: proxmoxve
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing proxmoxve cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`proxmoxve` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-proxmoxve).

pmApiTokenSecret.description: The secret uuid corresponding to a TokenID

pmDangerouslyIgnoreUnknownAttributes.description:
By default this provider will exit if an unknown attribute is found. This is to prevent the accidential destruction of
VMs or Data when something in the proxmox API has changed/updated and is not confirmed to work with this provider. Set
this to true at your own risk. It may allow you to proceed in cases when the provider refuses to work, but be aware of
the danger in doing so.

pmLogEnable.description: Enable provider logging to get proxmox API logs

pmLogFile.description: Write logs to this specific file

pmLogLevels.description: Configure the logging level to display; trace, debug, info, warn, etc

pmTlsInsecure.description:
By default, every TLS connection is verified to be secure. This option allows terraform to proceed and operate on
servers considered insecure. For example if you're connecting to a remote host and you do not have the CA cert that
issued the proxmox api url's certificate.

provider.description:
The provider type for the proxmoxve package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

pmApiTokenSecret.description: The secret uuid corresponding to a TokenID

pmDangerouslyIgnoreUnknownAttributes.description:
By default this provider will exit if an unknown attribute is found. This is to prevent the accidential destruction of
VMs or Data when something in the proxmox API has changed/updated and is not confirmed to work with this provider. Set
this to true at your own risk. It may allow you to proceed in cases when the provider refuses to work, but be aware of
the danger in doing so.

pmLogEnable.description: Enable provider logging to get proxmox API logs

pmLogFile.description: Write logs to this specific file

pmLogLevels.description: Configure the logging level to display; trace, debug, info, warn, etc

pmTlsInsecure.description:
By default, every TLS connection is verified to be secure. This option allows terraform to proceed and operate on
servers considered insecure. For example if you're connecting to a remote host and you do not have the CA cert that
issued the proxmox api url's certificate.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering LXCContainer resources.
Input properties used for looking up and filtering LXCDisk resources.

mac.deprecationMessage: Use `network.macaddr` to access the auto generated MAC address

rebootRequired.description: Internal variable, true if any of the modified parameters require a reboot to take effect.

unusedDisks.description: Record unused disks in proxmox. This is intended to be read-only for now.

mac.deprecationMessage: Use `network.macaddr` to access the auto generated MAC address

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering QemuVM resources.

mac.deprecationMessage: Use `network.macaddr` to access the auto generated MAC address

rebootRequired.description: Internal variable, true if any of the modified parameters require a reboot to take effect.

unusedDisks.description: Record unused disks in proxmox. This is intended to be read-only for now.
